definition: warm and virtuous/(used in given names)/Taiwan pr. [shu2]

sentences.english: Zhou Youping face the same good behavior, and the lady is no different.
sentences.chinese: 周友平面容姣好，行爲舉止，與淑女無異。

sentences.english: I don't think a lady would sag.
sentences.chinese: 我想一位淑女是不會穿寬鬆褲的。

sentences.english: Higgins tried to mould the cockney girl into a elegant lady.
sentences.chinese: 希金斯想把那個柔弱的女孩造就成一位高雅的淑女。

sentences.english: Favorite clothes: Students wear, ladies wear, urban fashion dress.
sentences.chinese: 學生裝，淑女裝，都市時尚裝扮。

sentences.english: No man may husband of woman, all wearing a lady's signature.
sentences.chinese: 凡是人盡可夫的女人，都掛着一個淑女的招牌。

sentences.english: She always conducts herself like a lady.
sentences.chinese: 她的舉止總如淑女一般。

sentences.english: Once there lived an old kind lady at the seaside, who had no children.
sentences.chinese: 一次在海浜住了一位舊的類型淑女，他沒有了孩子。

sentences.english: The ancients again cloud"engaging fair lady, gentleman good Qiu".
sentences.chinese: 古人又云“窈窕淑女，君子好逑”。

sentences.english: Front she were placed in pot inside and half alive half dead, and now it becomes like a lady.
sentences.chinese: 前面被燙的要死要活的，現在倒是像一個偏偏淑女了。

sentences.english: May be become a lady, and Wild Child will not be sticking to the regulations.
sentences.chinese: 可就算是變成淑女，野孩子也不會規規矩矩。

sentences.english: I'm here to see Lady Lien .
'You're behaving in an unladylike fashion, ' sniffed Mother.
sentences.chinese: “你的行爲不像淑女，”母親嗤笑道。

sentences.english: Where does the Ulterior Motives of “Lady Class” Offered by Colleges and Universities lie?
sentences.chinese: 高校開設“淑女班”醉翁之意何在？

sentences.english: We all know nice girls finish last.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道所謂淑女總要變壞的。

sentences.english: I can try to be a lady.
A lady does not wear scrappy sandals and airy open- toed shoes when working in a conservative business environment.
sentences.chinese: 淑女在保守的商務場所不穿雜亂裝飾和露腳趾的鞋。

definition: girl from a wealthy family/unmarried daughter of a noble house
(of a person's manner or character) gentle and quiet
pretty daughter in a humble family
(of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained
